title: New Liquid Chromatography Columns and Accessories: What to Know for 2023 - LCGC Chromatography Online
summary: The article presents an annual review of new liquid chromatography (LC) columns and accessories released between Pittcon 2022 and the 2023 conference. It discusses various product innovations from multiple vendors, focusing on advancements in column technologies and stationary phases. The review highlights new product lines and extensions, nontraditional formats, and inert column hardware developments. Overall, the emphasis is on the significant innovations within the liquid chromatography sector over the past year.

company: Chromanik Technologies Inc., Fortis Technologies Ltd., GL Sciences, Nacalai Tesque, Inc., Scion Instruments, United Chemical Technologies, ColumnTek, LLC, Daicel, Regis Technologies, Inc., and others mentioned.

product_or_process: Multiple products identified including SunShell C18, Evosphere, InertCore Plus C18, Cosmosil RNA-RP1, etc.

title: LABVOLUTION 2023: A Sneak Peek into the Future of Laboratory Technology - DirectIndustry e-Magazine
summary: LABVOLUTION is a prominent trade show in Hannover, Germany, that showcases innovations in laboratory technology, focusing on digitalization, automation, sustainability, and artificial intelligence. The event will feature new products, including sustainable innovations like plant-based cell culture systems, and discussions on genome editing and green chemistry for sustainable agriculture. It aims to revolutionize laboratory processes through interconnected equipment and showcases pioneering solutions in its smartLAB section. Key exhibitors include start-ups and industry leaders presenting innovative solutions for a more sustainable laboratory environment.
green_innovation: TRUE - The article discusses innovations aimed at promoting sustainability in laboratories, including a focus on green products like the plant-based PLA cell culture system.
business_innovation: TRUE - The article highlights new and improved laboratory technologies and equipment that differ significantly from previous offerings, which fits the definition of business innovation.
green_product: TRUE - The CellScrew cell culture system is designed to minimize environmental impact, aligning it with the definition of a green product.

title: Bisera Lozanovska enters the world of cosmetics and beauty through biochemistry - Fairleigh Dickinson University
summary: Bisera Lozanovska, an honors student at FDU, is preparing to graduate with a degree in biochemistry and has accepted a full-time job as a junior cosmetic chemist at Cosmax USA. Her interest in cosmetic science developed during high school, and she has gained valuable research experience and mentorship at FDU, contributing to academic publications and participating in professional societies. Lozanovska's work at Cosmax includes researching cosmetic ingredients and developing new products, fueled by her passion for combining science with creativity in beauty products.
